## MATHEMATICS

9709/22  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 303, 311, 319]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[710, 303, 907, 320]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 357, 395, 373]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 384, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 435, 880, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 664, 216, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 50.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 78, 97, 97]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
Given that \(\frac{2^{3x + 2} + 8}{2^{3x} - 7} = 5\), find the value of \(2^{3x}\) and hence, using logarithms, find the value of \(x\) correct to 4 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 102, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
Sketch, on a single diagram, the graphs of \(y = \left|\frac{1}{2} x - a\right|\) and \(y = \frac{3}{2} x - \frac{1}{2} a\), where \(a\) is a positive constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 88, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 377, 148, 395]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 376, 685, 395]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of the point of intersection of the two graphs.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 376, 920, 395]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 714, 186, 732]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 714, 608, 734]]<|/det|>
Deduce the solution of the inequality \(\left|\frac{1}{2} x - a\right| > \frac{3}{2} x - \frac{1}{2} a.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 718, 920, 737]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Use the trapezium rule with three intervals to find an approximation to the area of the shaded region. Give the answer correct to 2 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 85, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 479, 92]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is \(2\mathrm{e}^{2x}\mathrm{y} - \mathrm{y}^{3} + 4 = 0.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 109, 146, 128]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 107, 918, 135]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = \frac{4\mathrm{e}^{2x}\mathrm{y}}{3\mathrm{y}^2 - 2\mathrm{e}^{2x}}.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 112, 920, 131]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 82, 148, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 571, 109]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{2}\pi}(3 + 4\cos^{2}\frac{1}{2}x + k\sin 2x)\mathrm{d}x = 10.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 120, 462, 139]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of the constant \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[291, 83, 692, 310]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 327, 920, 364]]<|/det|>
A curve has equation \(\mathrm{y} = \mathrm{f}(\mathrm{x})\) where \(\mathrm{f}(\mathrm{x}) = \mathrm{x}^{4} - 5\mathrm{x}^{3} + 6\mathrm{x}^{2} + 5\mathrm{x} - 15.\) As shown in the diagram, the curve crosses the \(x\)-axis at the points \(A\) and \(B\) with coordinates \((a, 0)\) and \((b, 0)\) respectively.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 375, 146, 393]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 375, 648, 393]]<|/det|>
Use the factor theorem to show that \((x - 3)\) is a factor of \(\mathrm{f}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 375, 920, 393]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 584, 144, 603]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 584, 717, 603]]<|/det|>
By first finding the quotient when \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) is divided by \((x - 3)\), show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 611, 559, 647]]<|/det|>
\[a = -\sqrt{\frac{5}{2 - a}}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 622, 920, 640]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]
